intro: Verbesina quetamensis, commonly known as the Quetam sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features bright yellow flowers with a central disk, typical of the genus Verbesina. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
